data.name: RangedModDamageDesc
data.value: Range-Modefier for bows/guns/crossbows: Default range is somewhere between 0.3 and 0.4 yards, all blizzard ranged weapons have RangedModRange100

data.name: SpellChargesDesc
data.value: The number of times that the item can cast the spell. If 0, then infinite charges are possible. If negative, then after the number of charges is depleted, the item is deleted as well. If positive, then the item is not deleted after all the charges are spent.

data.name: SheathDesc
data.value: Controls how the item is put away on the character (pressing the 'Z' hotkey).

data.name: ReqSkillDesc
data.value: The skill required to use this item. See SkillLine.dbc

data.name: DurationDesc
data.value: he duration of the item in seconds. If positive, it is the duration measured in ingame time. If negative, it is the duration measured in real time.

data.name: MaxCountDesc
data.value: Maximum number of copies of this item a player can have. Use 0 for infinite

data.name: SpellCatCdDesc
data.value: The cooldown time in milliseconds that is applied to all other spells in the category that the triggered spell is also in. Use -1 to use the default spell cooldown.

data.name: ReqLevelDesc
data.value: Required level the player has to be to use this item.

data.name: SocketColorDesc
data.value: The color of the socket that can be placed in this item.

data.name: RandomPropDesc
data.value: The number in this field points to item_enchantment_template.entry and ties in an item's chance at having a random property attached to it when it shows up for the first time. This field and the RandomSuffix field CANNOT both have non-zero values. Either one is filled, or the other. Also, the primary source for the number in this field are WDBs.

data.name: DescriptionDesc
data.value: The description that appears in orange letters at the bottom of the item tooltip.

data.name: ReqHonorRankDesc
data.value: The honor rank the player needs to have to use this item.

data.name: PageTextDesc
data.value: The ID referring to the text that the item will show (if it is a book or a letter, etc). The item will have a magnifying glass cursor in the game and will show the text when right-clicked. See page_text.entry

data.name: DisenchantIdDesc
data.value: The disenchant loot template ID. See disenchant_loot_template.entry

data.name: ReqDisenchSkillDesc
data.value: The required proficiency in disenchanting that the player needs to have to be able to disenchant this item.

data.name: SpellIdDesc
data.value: The spell ID of the spell that the item can cast or trigger.

data.name: SpellPpmRateDesc
data.value: The proc per minute rate controlling how often the spell is triggered (if #spelltrigger == 2).

data.name: ReqSpellDesc
data.value: The required spell that the player needs to have to use this item

data.name: Hobbilis
data.value: ..\Resources\Hobbilis.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: ContainerSlotsDesc
data.value: If the item is a bag, this field controls the number of slots the bag has.

data.name: ReqRepFactionDesc
data.value: The faction template ID (from Faction.dbc) of the faction that the player has to have a certain ranking with. If this value is 0, the faction of the seller of the item is used.

data.name: Mitch528
data.value: ..\Resources\Mitch528.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: ScalingStatDistDesc
data.value: Similar to Static Stats these are the Stats that grow along with the users level (mainly heirloom leveling gear) use like static stats

data.name: MapDesc
data.value: The map ID that this item can be used in.

data.name: ItemSetDesc
data.value: The ID of the item set that this item belongs to. To save you some time, you CAN NOT make up new item sets. Item sets are defined in ItemSet.dbc

data.name: agt_action_success_16
data.value: ..\Resources\agt_action_success_16.ico;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: MaxMoneyLootDesc
data.value: If the item is a container that can contain money, then this field defines the maximum coinage held in this container, in copper.

data.name: BuyCountDesc
data.value: The size of the item stack when sold by vendors. Also if a vendor has limited copies of this item available, everytime the vendor list is refreshed (See npc_vendor.incrtime), the number of copies increases by this number.

data.name: AmmoTypeDesc
data.value: The type of ammunition the item uses

data.name: PageMatDesc
data.value: The background texture that appears in the page text window. PageTextMaterial.dbc

data.name: StartQuestDesc
data.value: The ID of the quest that this item will start if right-clicked. See quest_template.id

data.name: DelayDesc
data.value: The time in milliseconds between successive hits.

data.name: BagFamilyDesc
data.value: If the item is a bag, this field is a bitmask controlling what types of items can be put in this bag. You can combine different types by adding up the bit numbers.

data.name: SpellCdDesc
data.value: The cooldown in milliseconds for the specific spell controlling how often the spell can be used. Use -1 to use the default spell cooldown. Note: this is not the "internal cooldown" of procs commonly found on items such as trinkets with "Chance on hit" effects.

data.name: SellGoldDesc
data.value: The price that the vendor will pay you for the item when you sell it and if it is possible to be sold, in copper. Put in 0 if the item cannot be sold to a vendor.

data.name: agt_action_fail_16
data.value: ..\Resources\agt_action_fail_16.ico;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: FoodTypeDesc
data.value: If this item is a food type item, this field defines what type of food it is for hunters who want to feed their pets. It controls in what diet this food item falls in. NOTE: Raw meat and fish is not the same as regular meat and fish. It seems that the last two types of diets include grey "poor" types of food that players have no use for but some pets seem to be able to eat. Also, those food types appeared in TBC so most likely only TBC pets will have those types of diets.

data.name: RandomSuffixDesc
data.value: The number in this field points to item_enchantment_template.entry and ties in an item's chance at having a random suffix attached to it when it shows up for the first time. This field and the RandomProperty field CANNOT both have non-zero values. Either one is filled, or the other. Also, the primary source for the number in this field are WDBs.

data.name: StackableDesc
data.value: The number of copies of this item that can be stacked in the same slot.

data.name: MinMoneyLootDesc
data.value: If the item is a container that can contain money, then this field defines the minimum coinage held in this container, in copper.

data.name: SpellCatDesc
data.value: The category that the spell is in.

data.name: ScalingStatValueDesc
data.value: Final (level 80) value of the scaling-stat

data.name: ReqSkillRankDesc
data.value: The required skill rank the player needs to have to use this item.

data.name: SpellTriggerDesc
data.value: The type of trigger for the spell.

data.name: StatsCountDesc
data.value: When an item has entries in stat_type, this must be updated to display those entries (Unknown how this works)

data.name: MatDesc
data.value: The material that the item is made of. The value here affects the sound that the item makes when moved. Use -1 for consumable items like food, reagents, etc.

data.name: LanguageIdDesc
data.value: The language that the item text is written in. Languages.dbc

data.name: RandomArmorDmgModDesc
data.value: No description for this field, visit trinitycore website for more info.

data.name: LockIdDesc
data.value: The lock entry ID that this item (which serves as a key) is tied to. This field is used in key-door mechanics. See Lock.dbc

data.name: ScriptNameDesc
data.value: he name of the script that the item should use. There is no 'internalitemhandler' or 'internalitemhanler' script so trinity will ignore any such values in this field.

data.name: FlagsDesc
data.value: Bitmask field that contains flags that the item has on it. As all other such fields, just add the flags together to combine them. Possible flags are listed below

data.name: AllowConnDesc
data.value: Sets whether the world accepts new client connections. Even if the server is online.

data.name: TotemCatDesc
data.value: Corresponds to the ID in TotemCategory.dbc.

data.name: AreaDesc
data.value: The zone ID that this item can be used in.

data.name: Discover_
data.value: ..\Resources\Discover-.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: questionmark
data.value: ..\Resources\questionmark.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a
